1.text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus,

2.text: To Timothy, my dearly beloved son: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

3.text: I thank God, whom I serve from my forefathers with pure conscience, that without ceasing I have remembrance of thee in my prayers night and day;

4.text: Greatly desiring to see thee, being mindful of thy tears, that I may be filled with joy;

5.text: When I call to remembrance the unfeigned faith that is in thee, which dwelt first in thy grandmother Lois, and thy mother Eunice; and I am persuaded that in thee also.

6.text: For which cause I put thee in remembrance, that thou stir up the gift of God, which is in thee by the imposition of my hands.

7.text: For God hath not given us the spirit of fear, but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.

8.text: Be not thou therefore ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me his prisoner: but be thou partaker of the afflictions of the gospel according to the power of God;

9.text: Who hath saved us, and called us with a holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given to us in Christ Jesus before the world began;

10.text: But is now made manifest by the appearing of our Savior Jesus Christ, who hath abolished death, and hath brought life and immortality to light through the gospel:

11.text: To which I am appointed a preacher, and an apostle, and a teacher of the Gentiles.

12.text: For which cause I also suffer these things: nevertheless I am not ashamed: for I know whom I have believed, and am persuaded that he is able to keep that which I have committed to him against that day.

13.text: Hold fast the form of sound words, which thou hast heard from me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

14.text: That good thing which was committed to thee keep by the Holy Spirit which dwelleth in us.

15.text: This thou knowest, that all they who are in Asia are turned away from me; of whom are Phygellus and Hermogenes.

16.text: The Lord give mercy to the house of Onesiphorus; for he often refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain:

17.text: But, when he was in Rome, he sought me out very diligently, and found me.

18.text: The Lord grant to him that he may find mercy from the Lord in that day: and in how many things he ministered to me at Ephesus, thou knowest very well.
